content:
# Resume Text

```
KRISHNA PURWAR
ELECTRONICS ENGINEER
HARDWARE PROJECTS
Automated Smart Adaptive Parking Systems (ASAP)
 ASAP is an advanced solution for modern-day parking problems, offering a completely labor-free, automated 
process from reaching the parking lot to parking the vehicle and exiting. The prototype utilizes a vehicle number recognition system
through a Python script using OpenCV, along with simultaneous communication with Arduino, IR sensors, and Raspberry Pi.
Additionally, it includes the development of a website for pre- booking parking slots.
River-Cleaning Bot
Developed a Sustainable River cleaning bot by completely repurposing the waste materials like tyre tubes, waste plastics, etc and
additionally adding features like remote controlled operation, conveyor belt system, chlorine sprinkler and digital analyser that
detects parameters and sends via internet and has a capacity to hold 3-4 Kgs of waste.
Smart Wearable Device for Soldiers
A smart device, wearable around a forearm that ensures secure communication of ground station and soldier via 433MHz LoRa
modules, send commands, body vitals and environmental parameters and receive commands and display it over .96 OLED.
Centurio Game Deck is a Bluetooth-controlled gaming controller built using Arduino, joysticks, Bluetooth modules, and a Python
script that translates hardware input to game-level output.
Other projects include Project Nandi, a quadruped robot developed for a hackathon, Bit reader- A smart and customised QR code
scanner, automated/Manual Pesticide Sprayer that can be controlled via phone, the assembly and flying of a drone at IISc
Bangalore, and many other projects.
Centurio Game Deck
AI- driven Medicine Dispenser
Medicine dispenser using Face-recognition to provide medicines at the right time along with phone notification system- designed
for mental asylums, homes, etc.
TECHNICAL SKILLS
Embedded C 
TI MSP430 Microcontroller
 Arduino/ Rasberry pi/ ESP32/STM32
Altium/pspice/Proteus
HTML, CSS, JAVAscript
JAVA/Python/Django
Solidworks (CAD) 
Basic Electronics
SOFTWARE PROJECTS
MedHelp - AI-powered clinic management system with 85% accurate symptom analysis and reduced wait times..
Prixx - A highly dynamic student placement preparation website focusing on tech/non-tech and core domains and companies, AI
assisted Interview and analyser and question practising, using tech like HTML/CSS/JS, MySQL, LangChain,  Django, etc.
Project ENIGMA - A simple, creative and useful website which is a generative AI project which used GPT-3.5 using Flask and HTML as
its user Interface to summarize academic content such as Videos, PDFs and other documents.
Development of the home page of the E-summit website of RVCE.
My Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/in/krishna-purwar-b84810281
2008-2022
EDUCATION
Saint Dominic Savio college, Lucknow 
~Class X (ICSE) - 96.8% 
~Class XII (ISC) - 93%
Bachelor of Engineering in ELECTRONICS AND INSTRUMENTAION ENGINEERING at RVCE Bangalore 
~Grade - 9.33 GPA
2023-2027
EXPERIENCE
- August to October 2023
-December 2023 to Present
Worked as a Content Intern in MathanGo 
Displayed skills in soft communication, public speaking, content tagging, and team development,
significantly enhancing my experience and practical approach in the corporate world.
Technical Member in Team Antariksh, RVCE
Member at Telemetry subsystem and Power systems developing a High-Altitude Pseudo-satellite
Platform, along with that, sponsorship executive for the Team.
Conduction of events and handling operations within the society.
Secretory - IEEE Rvce Sensors Society
-January 2025 to Present
```

# Resume Text

```
Hayden Smith  
214 Mitre Avenue, Park Hill, 3045 |  04501 123 456  |  haydensmith@email.com 
Page 1 
 
 
(Tip: Name, mobile number and email address are essential. Current address could be included 
especially if you live nearby. Ensure that it is clearly displayed) 
Career Objective  
I am reliable hard working Year 11 student seeking casual or part-time customer service work in a 
sports retail environment. Having played soccer for nine years and a keen all-round sports 
enthusiast, I am looking to contribute knowledge and proven communications skills.  
 
(Tip: A career objective isn’t essential, but it’s useful if you don't have much experience and can 
convey enthusiasm and motivation. Briefly summarise any work you have done, your strengths and 
relevant expertise and state how you aim to apply this to your career goal. Adjust the statement to 
reflect the role you are applying for.)   
Availability 
Monday – Friday: 4.30pm – 10.00pm 
Saturday – Sunday: 8.00am – 11.00pm 
(up to 20 hours per week) 
 
(Tip: When looking for part-time casual work, it can be a good idea to include availability. If you’re a 
student, clearly state the maximum number of hours you are able to work per week.) 
Key Skills 
• 
Customer service ability demonstrated when working efficiently in soccer club canteen. 
• 
Numeracy skills for cash handling tasks proven by achieving good results for mathematics 
subjects.  
• 
Highly developed communication skills shown by receiving positive feedback from 
supervisors after completing work experience.  
• 
Strong ability to work as part of a team developed through participating in soccer since the 
age of eight. 
• 
Demonstrated organisation skills as a result handing all assignments in on time. 
• 
Able to take responsibility and solve problems proven through umpiring and coaching.  
 
 (Tip: Include 5-9 key skills as bullet points that you like using and that are relevant to the role. When 
applying for advertised roles, match to any criteria listed in the advertisement. Use action words such 
as ‘demonstrated’ or ‘highly developed’ and then provide information about when, where and how 
you’ve used the skill through your studies, work experience, volunteering, sporting activities, etc.) 
Education 
Current  
 
Park Hill Secondary College 
 
Year 11 
• 
Subjects include: Maths, English, Business Management, VET studies in Sport and 
Recreation. 
 
(Tip: List your most recent education qualifications first including any relevant university degrees and 
certificates. Professional development such as short training courses, workshops, licences, forms of 
accreditation, and other training can be included but is usually a separate heading.) 
Work Experience  
 
 
Hayden Smith 
Page 2 
 
December 2016 – March 2017 
Park Hill Soccer Club Canteen  
Customer service (volunteer) 
• 
Served customers. 
• 
Handled cash including operating of cash register. 
 
June 2016 – February 2017 
Argo Newsagency 
 
 
Newspaper deliverer 
• 
Delivered weekend newspapers to houses. 
 
(Tip: Focus on most recent work experience first. Include your job title, organisation name and dates. 
Years and months can be included. Include responsibilities and achievements for each role.) 
Leadership Roles  
2016 – current  
 
 
 
Soccer umpire for under 14 team 
Park Hill Soccer Club 
 
2017 – current  
 
 
 
Assistant Coach for junior players 
Park Hill Soccer Club 
 
(Tip: Include any volunteering, community participation or leaderships roles.) 
Interests/Hobbies 
• 
Played soccer since the age of eight. 
• 
Keen spectator of soccer, football and cricket. 
 
(Tip: Including a section on interests can be useful if it’s relevant and active. Only include those 
interests which are relevant to the job you are applying for or those which demonstrate your 
proactive or positive traits.)    
 
Referees 
John Charles 
Coach 
Hill Park Soccer Club 
0456 789 101 
John_charles@hillpark.edu 
Wendy Stevens 
Year 11 Coordinator 
Hill Park Secondary College 
*Contact details available on request 
 
(Tip: If you decide to include referee contacts, notify the referee and indicate the type of roles that 
you will be applying for. You may also want to provide them with a copy of your resume. You can 
also simply write ‘Available on request’.)
```

# Resume Text

```
SIDDHANT SINGH
+91 7376151772
iamnotsiddhantsingh@gmail.com
EDUCATION
RV COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING
DPS ELDECO, LUCKNOW
BE Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering, CGPA : 8.73
PCM CBSE, XII : 87.2
SKILL
Programming Languages:
PROJECTS
Prixx – Placement Preparation Website (Ongoing Project)
Working as part of a team to develop "Prixx," a platform designed to assist students in placement preparation.
The website features an AI-enabled resume builder, AI-powered interview simulations, a community chat
system, and access to previous years' placement papers.
Autonomous River Cleaning Bot
Developed an Autonomous Water Body Cleaner as part of a hackathon project, aimed at improving water
quality by detecting pollution levels and collecting floating waste. The system features a conveyor belt for
efficient debris collection. Additionally, an Android application was integrated to provide real-time sensor
data, enabling remote monitoring and control.
Smart Wearable Device for  Soilders
Developed a smart wearable device for soldiers to enhance communication and health monitoring. The
device integrates a LoRa module for secure message transmission between soldiers and headquarters, GPS
for accurate positioning, and an OLED screen to display messages and real-time sensor readings. Equipped
with multiple sensors, including body temperature, heartbeat, DHT, and gas sensors, the system ensures
continuous health monitoring in the field.
Bengaluru, Karnataka
2023 - 2027
2020 - 2022
DPS KALYANPUR, KANPUR 2012 - 2020
CBSE, X : 86.2
C++, Python, Django, HTML, CSS
Embedded Systems:
Arduino, ESP32
Developed an automated concrete mixing system aimed at enhancing sustainability in construction by
improving concrete quality and reducing environmental impact. The system integrates fly ash, an industrial
by-product, to enhance workability, reduce water demand, and increase durability while minimizing waste.
Automation ensures precise material measurement, reducing inconsistencies, dust pollution, and manual
labor in the mixing process. This innovation contributes to eco-friendly construction practices by optimizing
resource utilization and improving long-term structural performance.
Automated concrete mixing system
Automatic Billing System
Developed an Automatic Billing System using RFID technology to automate checkout, reducing wait times and
improving inventory management. The system scans products in real time, updating the bill automatically,
enhancing efficiency in retail shopping.
```

```
Functional Resume Sample 
 
John W. Smith  
2002 Front Range Way Fort Collins, CO 80525  
jwsmith@colostate.edu 
 
Career Summary 
 
Four years experience in early childhood development with a diverse background in the care of 
special needs children and adults.  
  
Adult Care Experience 
 
• Determined work placement for 150 special needs adult clients.  
• Maintained client databases and records.  
• Coordinated client contact with local health care professionals on a monthly basis.     
• Managed 25 volunteer workers.     
 
Childcare Experience 
 
• Coordinated service assignments for 20 part-time counselors and 100 client families. 
• Oversaw daily activity and outing planning for 100 clients.  
• Assisted families of special needs clients with researching financial assistance and 
healthcare. 
• Assisted teachers with managing daily classroom activities.    
• Oversaw daily and special student activities.     
 
Employment History  
 
1999-2002 
Counseling Supervisor, The Wesley Center, Little Rock, Arkansas.    
1997-1999 
Client Specialist, Rainbow Special Care Center, Little Rock, Arkansas  
1996-1997 
Teacher’s Assistant, Cowell Elementary, Conway, Arkansas     
 
Education 
 
University of Arkansas at Little Rock, Little Rock, AR  
 
• BS in Early Childhood Development (1999) 
• BA in Elementary Education (1998) 
• GPA (4.0 Scale):  Early Childhood Development – 3.8, Elementary Education – 3.5, 
Overall 3.4.  
• Dean’s List, Chancellor’s List
```
